variable.name: SkinSettingsHelpTextVar
variable.value: Configure what the power button in the home screen mini menu does. OPEN SHUTDOWN MENU is the default option for Kodi. This will open the shutdown menu when the power button in the homescreen mini menu is clicked. EXIT will close Kodi with one click. NOTE: The homescreen label will change according which option is set.

Configure what pressing the back button on the home screen widgets will do. OPEN MAIN MENU will save the current focus postion and then open the main menu. RESET WIDGET will return the focus position back to the first item in the widget. BOTH will simultaneously reset the focus position back to the first item in the widget and open the main menu.

Configure what pressing the left button on the home screen widgets will do. If the current focus positon is on the first item in the widget, OPEN MAIN MENU will open the main menu, WRAP TO END will set the focus position to the LAST item in the widget.

Enabling this option will set the focus frame around items to use the color from the current color theme. This setting applies to all menu items such as posters and category widgets but it excludes list items. If this option is disabled it will use the color from the default color theme.
Enabling this option will show the current time in the InfoLine located right above the widget items. This will show in the homescreen, search window, and all video windows.
Enabling this option will show colored studio logos for media content in the FlixPanel.
Set your desired search provider. This will use the selected addon for searches in the search window and default search dialog. This setting can be changed on the fly in the search window mini menu.

Enabling this option will use the built-in search window. Disabling this option will use the default search dialog. The advantage to using the search window is that you can see results for multiple media types all at once (movies, tvshows, etc).

Set the search window behavior. OPEN KEYBOARD will open a keybaord when the Search button is clicked in the homescreen mini menu. OPEN SEARCH WINDOW will open the search window where you can see your search history, view TRAKT lists, etc.

variable.value: Enabling or disable the showing of specific search widgets.
Click to clear the search history. The search history can also be cleared via the mini menu in the search window.
If you do not have a MDBList API key, please go to https://mdblist.com to sign up for a free API key.

Toggle trailer viewing options. OFF: Disable all skin trailer functions. ONE-CLICK: Trailers are played by long pressing the play/pause button or the "t" key on a keyboard. AUTO: Trailers are automatically played after an item has been focused and the delay time has passed.
Set the amount of time to wait before playing the trailer.
Enabling this option will show a small play icon at the beginning of the InfoLine. This icon works as a visual indication of when a trailer is loaded and ready to be played.

variable.value: Enabling or disable the showing of specific ratings.
Remove your API key. This will remove all ratings from the skin.

Clear the ratings cache. This will remove all stored ratings in the database and fetch brand new ones when an item is focused. It is not recommended to use this often as retrieving new ratings is slower and involves more API calls.
Enabling this option will show clearlogos for media content. Disabling this option will use a default text title.
Choose your preferred font style for text titles.
Enabling this option will blur the background for media content. Disabling this option will use a default black background.
This option sets the intensity of the background blur. Higher values will wash out more detail. Lower values will keep more detail. RECOMMENDED VALUES: 2-40.

This option sets the color intensity of the background blur. Higher values will create more saturated intense colors. Lower values will create less intense, more neutral colors. RECOMMENDED VALUES:[CR]FANART.TV ARTWORK: 2.0 | TMDB ARTWORK: 2.5

Click to clear the blur cache. You can see the size of the cache in megabytes on the right. NOTE: The cache does not need to be cleared when changing the blur radius or saturation values in order for the changes to take effect.
